label: 猿楽
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: A genre of early medieval theater which included music, dance, and other types of entertainment. As sarugaku developed, it absorbed elements of another performing art known as dengaku and became increasingly standardized. The tradition emerging from this process formed the basis on which noh was created in the fourteenth century.　[田楽、能]
